channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Water is STILL running down the side of the road from the top of the hill. It has NOT been fixed, 25th August
item.description:
New Road approaching Woodmancote. Top of hill opposite entrance to former Haymes Mushroom Farm. Grid Ref.: 972267. NOT at the cross roads with Gambles Lane and Two Hedges Road. Could be a field drain which is malfunctioning.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Unauthorised flags attached to lamp posts, 25th August
item.description:

item.title: The proper device for securing this tree is broken. I have been using string to try and keep it upright but I fear it isn’t strong enough and this tree will break, 25th August
item.description:
By the bus stop at the junction of Salisbury Avenue and Winchester way out side 49 Winchester way on council grass verge

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Salisbury Avenue, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain, 25th August
item.description:
The drain is blocked, it is at least a spades depth of soil as we have tried to rectify the issue ourselves.this was reported in April and nothing has been done about it, access should not be an issue as it is at the edge of a marked out disabled space. The drain is outside number 25/27 Alexandra Street. Rain will not drain and we are due heavy downfall after a period of drought so this is a concern.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Alexandra Street, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flags attached to street lights, making me feel unsafe, 25th August
item.description:
Flags have been attached overnight to several street lights in the Central reservation of Tewkesbury road, by the garage and Lidl. I am white British, but I find this display not only breaks the law, but is also intimidating as a symbol if the far right. There must be cctv footage available to prosecute the offenders.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
